title.narrative: 2.3 SANITATION AND HYGIENE IN COMMUNITIES

description.narrative: 2.3 Communities have increased capacities and commitment to use basic sanitation facilities and demonstrate improved hygiene and sanitation practices and behaviors, particularly in UNICEF-targeted districts., which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Reducing Child Poverty, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more children and their families, particularly in rural and poor urban areas, have access to and use affordable and sustainable basic water and sanitation services, and practices safe hygiene behaviors

sector.narrative: Water supply and sanitation - large systems

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.3 Communities have increased capacities and commitment to use basic sanitation facilities and demonstrate improved hygiene andsanitation practices and behaviors, particularly in UNICEF-targeted districts.

description.narrative: By the end of 2021, access to basic sanitation services reached an additional 66,428 people compared to 29,071 people in 2020 and additional 84,612 people, compared to 34,512 in 2020, now live in Open Defecation Free communities due to UNICEF support. However, despite these achievements, these are behind the targets set in the Country Programme and UNICEF will continue to support the government in accelerating results, including in the implementation of the National Strategy on Sanitation and Hygiene Promotion and scaling-up the Chiefdom-Wide approach to accelerate sanitation uptake in Sierra Leone. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
